metadata.title: CVE-2024-36925 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:swiotlb: initialise restricted pool list_head when SWIOTLB_DYNAMIC=yUsing restricted DMA pools (CONFIG_DMA_RESTRICTED_POOL=y) in conjunctionwith dynamic SWIOTLB (CONFIG_SWIOTLB_DYNAMIC=y) leads to the followingcrash when initialising the restricted pools at boot-time:  | Unable to handle kernel NULL pointer dereference at virtual address0000000000000008  | Internal error: Oops: 0000000096000005 [#1] PREEMPT SMP  | pc : rmem_swiotlb_device_init+0xfc/0x1ec  | lr : rmem_swiotlb_device_init+0xf0/0x1ec  | Call trace:  |  rmem_swiotlb_device_init+0xfc/0x1ec  |  of_reserved_mem_device_init_by_idx+0x18c/0x238  |  of_dma_configure_id+0x31c/0x33c  |  platform_dma_configure+0x34/0x80faddr2line reveals that the crash is in the list validation code:  include/linux/list.h:83  include/linux/rculist.h:79  include/linux/rculist.h:106  kernel/dma/swiotlb.c:306  kernel/dma/swiotlb.c:1695because add_mem_pool() is trying to list_add_rcu() to a NULL'mem->pools'.Fix the crash by initialising the 'mem->pools' list_head inrmem_swiotlb_device_init() before calling add_mem_pool().
